content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: SSSTRESC
      operator: equal_to
      value: DEAD
      value_is_literal: true
    - name: $ds_dsdecod
      operator: does_not_contain
      value: DEATH
      value_is_literal: true
Operations:
  - operator: distinct
    domain: DS
    name: DSDECOD
    id: $ds_dsdecod
    group:
      - USUBJID
Core:
  Id: NA
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when SS.SSSTRESC = "DEAD" and DSDECOD ^= "DEATH".
Outcome:
  Message: DSDECOD is not "DEATH", When SS.SSSTRESC = "DEAD".
  Output Variables:
    - SSSTRESC
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC - something new
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0067
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: For example, if a subject's survival status is "DEAD", the date
                  of death must be stored in DM and within a final disposition
                  record in DS.
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 1
                Section: 6.3.11
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - FINDINGS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - SS

json.Description: Raise an error when SS.SSSTRESC = "DEAD" and DSDECOD ^= "DEATH".

Citations.Cited_Guidance: For example, if a subject's survival status is "DEAD", the date of death must be stored in DM and within a final disposition record in DS.
